@description.name: @description
@description.body: The CellSpanManager manages cells, which span several rows or columns. It provides functionality to compute, which spanning cells are visible in a given view port and how they have to be placed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
rowConfig {qx.ui.virtual.core.Axis} The row configuration of the pane
    in which the cells will be rendered
@param.description:
The row configuration of the pane
    in which the cells will be rendered

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
columnConfig {qx.ui.virtual.core.Axis} The column configuration of the pane
    in which the cells will be rendered
@param.description:
The column configuration of the pane
    in which the cells will be rendered

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a spanning cell to the manager.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
id {String} Unique id for the cell definition. This id is required
    for removing the cell from the manager
@param.description:
Unique id for the cell definition. This id is required
    for removing the cell from the manager

@param.name: @param
@param.body: row {PositiveInteger} The cell's row

@param.name: @param
@param.body: column {PositiveInteger} The cell's column

@param.name: @param
@param.body: rowSpan {PositiveInteger} The number of rows the cells spans
@param.description: The number of rows the cells spans

@param.name: @param
@param.body: columnSpan {PositiveInteger} The number of columns the cells spans
@param.description: The number of columns the cells spans

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove a cell from the manager

@param.name: @param
@param.body: id {String} The id of the cell to remove
@param.description: The id of the cell to remove

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Invalidate the sort cache

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the cell array sorted by the given key (ascending)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: key {String} The sort key. One of firstRow, lastRow, firstColumn or lastColumn
@param.description: The sort key. One of firstRow, lastRow, firstColumn or lastColumn

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Finds all cells with a sort key within the given range. Complexity: O(log n)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: key {String} The key to search for

@param.name: @param
@param.body: min {Integer} minimum value

@param.name: @param
@param.body: max {Integer} maximum value (inclusive)

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} Map, which will contain the search results
@return.description: Map, which will contain the search results

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Find all cells, which are visible in the given grid window.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: firstRow {PositiveInteger} first visible row

@param.name: @param
@param.body: firstColumn {PositiveInteger} first visible column

@param.name: @param
@param.body: rowCount {PositiveInteger} number of rows in the window
@param.description: number of rows in the window

@param.name: @param
@param.body: columnCount {PositiveInteger} number of columns in the window
@param.description: number of columns in the window

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map[]} The array of found cell descriptions. A cell description contains the keys firstRow, lastRow, firstColumn or lastColumn
@return.description: The array of found cell descriptions. A cell description contains the keys firstRow, lastRow, firstColumn or lastColumn

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the intersection of two maps as an array. The objects intersect if they have the same keys.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: setA {Object} The first map

@param.name: @param
@param.body: setB {Object} The second map

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String[]} An array keys found in both maps
@return.description: An array keys found in both maps

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for row configuration changes

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Event} the event object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler for column configuration changes

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Event} the event object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Invalidates the row/column position cache

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the pixel start position of the given row

@param.name: @param
@param.body: row {Integer} The row index

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The pixel start position of the given row
@return.description: The pixel start position of the given row

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the pixel start position of the given column

@param.name: @param
@param.body: column {Integer} The column index

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The pixel start position of the given column
@return.description: The pixel start position of the given column

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the bounds of a single cell

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cell {Map} the cell description as returned by
    {@link #findCellsInWindow} to get the bounds for
@param.description:
the cell description as returned by
    {@link #findCellsInWindow} to get the bounds for

@param.name: @param
@param.body: firstVisibleRow {Map} The pane's first visible row

@param.name: @param
@param.body: firstVisibleColumn {Map} The pane's first visible column

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} Boundaries map with the keys left, top, width and height
@return.description: Boundaries map with the keys left, top, width and height

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the bounds of a list of cells as returned by {@link #findCellsInWindow}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: cells {Map[]} Array of cell descriptions

@param.name: @param
@param.body: firstVisibleRow {Map} The pane's first visible row

@param.name: @param
@param.body: firstVisibleColumn {Map} The pane's first visible column

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map[]} Array, which contains a bounds map for each cell.
@return.description: Array, which contains a bounds map for each cell.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Compute a bitmap, which marks for each visible cell, whether the cell is covered by a spanning cell.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cells {Map[]} Array of cell descriptions as returned by
     {@link #findCellsInWindow}.
@param.description:
Array of cell descriptions as returned by
     {@link #findCellsInWindow}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: firstRow {PositiveInteger} first visible row

@param.name: @param
@param.body: firstColumn {PositiveInteger} first visible column

@param.name: @param
@param.body: rowCount {PositiveInteger} number of rows in the window
@param.description: number of rows in the window

@param.name: @param
@param.body: columnCount {PositiveInteger} number of columns in the window
@param.description: number of columns in the window

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map[][]} Two dimensional array, which contains a 1 for each visible cell, which is covered by a spanned cell.
@return.description: Two dimensional array, which contains a 1 for each visible cell, which is covered by a spanned cell.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxObjectId. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.
